pullRequest.title: Deprecate synced flush
pullRequest.bodyText:
A normal flush has the same effect as a synced flush on Elasticsearch 7.6 or later. It's deprecated in 7.6 and will be removed in 8.0.
Relates #50776

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * Please use normal {@link #flush(FlushRequest, RequestOptions)} instead.
          
          
            
                 * Use {@link #flush(FlushRequest, RequestOptions)} instead.
          
      
    
    
  

While "please" is polite, I think brevity is more important here.
I also think we can just say "flush" instead of "normal flush."
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -423,7 +423,10 @@ public Cancellable flushAsync(FlushRequest flushRequest, RequestOptions options,
      * @param options the request options (e.g. headers), use {@link RequestOptions#DEFAULT} if nothing needs to be customized
      * @return the response
      * @throws IOException in case there is a problem sending the request or parsing back the response
+     * @deprecated synced flush is deprecated and will be removed in future Elasticsearch versions.
+     * Please use normal {@link #flush(FlushRequest, RequestOptions)} instead.

This needs to start as deprecated::[ (note the two ::). I also would move it to the very top of the page, right after the heading.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3,8 +3,13 @@
 --------------------------------------------------
 POST _flush/synced
 --------------------------------------------------
+// TEST[skip: will fail as synced flush is deprecated]
 
 When you perform a synced flush, check the response to make sure there are
 no failures. Synced flush operations that fail due to pending indexing
 operations are listed in the response body, although the request itself
 still returns a 200 OK status. If there are failures, reissue the request.
+
+Note that synced flush is deprecated and will be removed in future versions.
